Package edu.vassar.cmpu102.tictactoe

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.vassar.cmpu102.tictactoe.Game
  • public class Game
extends Object
    Represents a Tic-tac-toe game.
    Version:
    CMPU-102 special edition
    Author:
    Rui Meireles

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field Description
      (package private) char[][] board

      (package private) int boardSize
      represents board size, which will be a boardSize x boardSize matrix

      holds references to the game's players
      (package private) char SYMBOL_BLANK
      the character to be used to represent a blank space on the board (' ')
      (package private) char SYMBOL_CPU
      the character to be used to represent a cpu move on the board ('O')
      (package private) char SYMBOL_HUMAN
      the character to be used to represent a human move on the board ('X')

    • Method Detail

      • getBoardSize

        public int getBoardSize()
        Returns the game board size.
        Returns:

      • resetGame

        protected void resetGame()
        Resets the game state so we can play again.

      • isValidMove

        public char isValidMove​(Move move)
        Validates a potential move. Returns 'V' if the move is valid, or a different character indicating the reason why the move is invalid.
        Parameters:
        move - the move to be validated.
        Returns:
        'V' is move is valid, 'R' if it specifies an invalid row, 'C' if it specifies an invalid column, or 'O' if it refers to an already-occupied position.

      • executeMove

        protected boolean executeMove​(Move move,
                              char symbol)
        Executes the move passed as an argument. If the move is invalid it returns false.
        Parameters:
        move - the move to be executed
        symbol - the symbol of the player who is making the move
        Returns:
        true if the move was successfully executed

      • getGameStatus

        public char getGameStatus()
        A method that analyzes the board to determine the current game sate, which is then returned as a character. A game is over if either player has completed a row, a line, or a diagonal. Moreover, a game is also over if the board is full, even if no player completed a row, line, or diagonal. That indicates a tie situation.
        Returns:
        A character indicating the game state: '?' if the game isn't over yet, 'T' if the game is over and tied, or, if a player won, the winning player's symbol ('X' or 'O').

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Creates a textual representation of the game board in the format: 
            1   2   3
 A  X | O | O 
   ---|---|---
 B    | X |   
   ---|---|---
 C  O |   | X
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        A String representing the game board in the aforementioned format.

      • playSingleGame

        public char playSingleGame()
        Plays a single game of Tic-tac-toe by having players pick moves in turn. The first player to play is choosen uniformly at random.
        Returns:
        A character representing the game's result: 'H' if the human player won, 'C' if the CPU won, 'T' if there was a tie, or 'Q' if the human quit the game.

      • main

        public static void main​(String[] args)
        Runs consecutive Tic-tac-toe games until the user gets tired and quits. When the user quits, the win-loss-tie statistics are printed.
        Parameters:
        args - The first argument represents the desired game board size, which should be an integer in [1,9]. If the provided board size does not comply with these rules or if no argument is provided, a default game board size of 3 x 3 will be used.
